channel.title: PicLens - Amazing new firefox extension!
channel.description:
[center][size=30pt]PicLens!!! [/size][/center] Alright PicLens is like really cool when browsing image websties like Deviantart or Flickr. Just hover over a picture and click the little play button and it loads all the pictures (even if they are on page two of a gallery) and displays them in a fantastically appealing manner.
Download: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/5579
Just install PicLens on Firefox and visit this site http://www.flickr.com/search/?q=tiger.
Then hover over the first image and click the play button. Notice how even though you only see a few on the website, when in PicLens you see all results for tiger!
Features include:
[ul][li]Panning[/li] [li]Zooming in and out[/li] [li]Slideshows[/li] [li]Search[/li] [li]Sexy interface![/li][/ul]
It works on the following sites:
* Flickr, Smugmug, DeviantArt, Photobucket, Picasa, FotoTime, Fotki * Facebook, MySpace, Bebo, Hi5, Friendster * Image search on Google, Yahoo, Ask, Live, and AOL * A growing number of Media RSS-enabled web sites

@Aim wrote:

Wow. This is amazing. I went to google images and searched waterfall, and it relaxed me all over

item.title: PicLens - Amazing new firefox extension!
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Does it have a gay 300 pixel high toolbar with 200 useless sponsored search engines integrated?

I’m assuming it’s not as shitty as the IE toolbars, and installing it now.

EDIT: OMFG. That is the fucking sweetest plugin EVER. Go here: http://browse.deviantart.com/customization/wallpaper/fractals/?order=9&alltime=yes
Then start up the plugin, it goes onnn and onnn and onn.

Read full topic

item.title: PicLens - Amazing new firefox extension!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[center][size=30pt]PicLens!!!
[/size][/center]
Alright PicLens is like really cool when browsing image websties like Deviantart or Flickr. Just hover over a picture and click the little play button and it loads all the pictures (even if they are on page two of a gallery) and displays them in a fantastically appealing manner.

Download: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/5579

Just install PicLens on Firefox and visit this site http://www.flickr.com/search/?q=tiger.

Then hover over the first image and click the play button. Notice how even though you only see a few on the website, when in PicLens you see all results for tiger!

Features include:

[ul][li]Panning[/li]
[li]Zooming in and out[/li]
[li]Slideshows[/li]
[li]Search[/li]
[li]Sexy interface![/li][/ul]

It works on the following sites:

  • Flickr, Smugmug, DeviantArt, Photobucket, Picasa, FotoTime, Fotki
  • Facebook, MySpace, Bebo, Hi5, Friendster
  • Image search on Google, Yahoo, Ask, Live, and AOL
  • A growing number of Media RSS-enabled web sites
